alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 6:55AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A BAND OF LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF ONONDAGA...ONEIDA...AND MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH THE MORNING COMMUTE... A band of lake effect snow will bring light accumulations to the area this morning, including the Syracuse metro area. Accumulations will mostly be on grassy surfaces, but some untreated roads could become slick, especially bridges and overpasses. Snowfall amounts will vary widely, with generally a trace to a half inch in urbanized lower elevations, around an inch in rural lowlands, and up to 2 inches in hilly terrain. Visibility may be reduced to less than a mile at times. Snow is expected to taper off by late morning. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Onondaga, Syracuse, Utica, Clay, Rome, Cicero, De Witt, Lysander, Sullivan, and Van Buren. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 31 and 39. New York Interstate 81 between 15 and 31. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida
